intro: Pseudanthus orientalis, commonly known as the oriental pseudanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disc of smaller florets. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its botanical structure supports pollination by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native environment.
